clearRect

public void clearRect(double x,
                      double y,
                      double width,
                      double height)
Clears the specified rectangle by filling it with the background color of the current drawing surface. This operation does not use the current paint mode.

The background color of offscreen images may be system dependent. Applications should use setColor followed by fillRect to ensure that an offscreen image is cleared to a specific color.

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of the rectangle to clear in inches.
y - the y coordinate of the rectangle to clear in inches.
width - the width of the rectangle to clear in inches.
height - the height of the rectangle to clear in inches.

height - the height of the rectangle to clear in inches.

copyArea

public void copyArea(double x,
                     double y,
                     double width,
                     double height,
                     double dx,
                     double dy)
Copies an area of the component by a distance specified by dx and dy. From the point specified by x and y, this method copies downwards and to the right. To copy an area of the component to the left or upwards, specify a negative value for dx or dy. If a portion of the source rectangle lies outside the bounds of the component, or is obscured by another window or component, copyArea will be unable to copy the associated pixels. The area that is omitted can be refreshed by calling the component's paint method.

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of the source rectangle in inches.
y - the y coordinate of the source rectangle in inches.
width - the width of the source rectangle in inches.
height - the height of the source rectangle in inches.
dx - the horizontal distance to copy the pixels inches.
dy - the vertical distance to copy the pixels in inches.

drawString

                       double x,
                       double y)
Draws the text given by the specified string, using this graphics context's current font and color. The baseline of the leftmost character is at position (x, y) in inches

Parameters:
s - the string to be drawn.
x - the x coordinate in inches.
y - the y coordinate in inches.

draw3DRect

public void draw3DRect(double x,
                       double y,
                       double width,
                       double height,
                       boolean raised)
Draws a 3-D highlighted outline of the specified rectangle. The edges of the rectangle are highlighted so that they appear to be beveled and lit from the upper left corner.

The colors used for the highlighting effect are determined based on the current color. The resulting rectangle covers an area that is width + 1 inches wide by height + 1 inches tall.

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of the rectangle to be drawn.
y - the y coordinate of the rectangle to be drawn.
width - the width of the rectangle to be drawn.
height - the height of the rectangle to be drawn.
raised - a boolean that determines whether the rectangle appears to be raised above the surface or sunk into the surface.

drawArc

public void drawArc(double x,
                    double y,
                    double width,
                    double height,
                    int startAngle,
                    int arcAngle)
Draws the outline of a circular or elliptical arc covering the specified rectangle.

The resulting arc begins at startAngle and extends for arcAngle degrees, using the current color. Angles are interpreted such that 0 degrees is at the 3 o'clock position. A positive value indicates a counter-clockwise rotation while a negative value indicates a clockwise rotation.

The center of the arc is the center of the rectangle whose origin is (x, y) and whose size is specified by the width and height arguments.

The resulting arc covers an area width + 1 pixels wide by height + 1 pixels tall.

The angles are specified relative to the non-square extents of the bounding rectangle such that 45 degrees always falls on the line from the center of the ellipse to the upper right corner of the bounding rectangle. As a result, if the bounding rectangle is noticeably longer in one axis than the other, the angles to the start and end of the arc segment will be skewed farther along the longer axis of the bounds.

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of the upper-left corner of the arc to be drawn.
y - the y coordinate of the upper-left corner of the arc to be drawn.
width - the width of the arc to be drawn.
height - the height of the arc to be drawn.
startAngle - the beginning angle.
arcAngle - the angular extent of the arc, relative to the start angle.

drawImage

public void drawImage(byte[] buf,
                      double x,
                      double y,
                      double width,
                      double height)
Draws the specified image as has already been scaled to fit inside the specified rectangle.

The image is drawn inside the specified rectangle of this graphics context's coordinate space, and is scaled if necessary. Transparent pixels do not affect whatever pixels are already there.

This method will ensure the completion of drawing.

Parameters:
buf - the specified image to be drawn.
x - the x coordinate in inches.
y - the y coordinate in inches.
width - the width of the rectangle in inches.
height - the height of the rectangle in inches.

drawImage

public void drawImage(java.io.File file,
                      double x,
                      double y,
                      double width,
                      double height)
Draws an image stored in a file.

The image is drawn inside the specified rectangle of this graphics context's coordinate space, and is scaled if necessary. Transparent pixels do not affect whatever pixels are already there.

This method will ensure the completion of drawing.

Parameters:
file - the file stores the image to be drawn.
x - the x coordinate in inches.
y - the y coordinate in inches.
width - the width of the rectangle in inches.
height - the height of the rectangle in inches.

The image is drawn inside a paragraph that have enough space for the image.

This method will ensure the completion of drawing.

Parameters:
buf - the specified image to be drawn.
cap - a string describes the image.
width - the width of the rectangle in inches.
height - the height of the rectangle in inches.
align - alignment position.

drawOval

public void drawOval(double x,
                     double y,
                     double width,
                     double height)
Draws the outline of an oval. The result is a circle or ellipse that fits within the rectangle specified by the x, y, width, and height arguments.

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of the upper left corner of the oval to be drawn in inches.
y - the y coordinate of the upper left corner of the oval to be drawn in inches.
width - the width of the oval to be drawn in inches.
height - the height of the oval to be drawn in inches.

drawPolygon

public void drawPolygon(double[] xPoints,
                        double[] yPoints,
                        int nPoints)
Draws a closed polygon defined by arrays of x and y coordinates. Each pair of (x, y) coordinates defines a point.

This method draws the polygon defined by nPoint line segments, where the first nPoint - 1 line segments are line segments from (xPoints[i - 1], yPoints[i - 1]) to (xPoints[i], yPoints[i]), for 1 ≤ i ≤ nPoints. The figure is automatically closed by drawing a line connecting the final point to the first point, if those points are different.

Parameters:
xPoints - a an array of x coordinates in inches.
yPoints - a an array of y coordinates in inches.
nPoints - a the total number of points.

drawPolyline

public void drawPolyline(double[] xPoints,
                         double[] yPoints,
                         int nPoints)
Draws a sequence of connected lines defined by arrays of x and y coordinates. Each pair of (x, y) coordinates defines a point. The figure is not closed if the first point differs from the last point.

Parameters:
xPoints - an array of x points in inches.
yPoints - an array of y points in inches.
nPoints - the total number of points

drawRect

public void drawRect(double x,
                     double y,
                     double width,
                     double height)
Draws the outline of the specified rectangle. The left and right edges of the rectangle are at x and x + width. The top and bottom edges are at y and y + height. The rectangle is drawn using the graphics context's current color.

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of the rectangle to be drawn in inches.
y - the y coordinate of the rectangle to be drawn in inches.
width - the width of the rectangle to be drawn in inches.
height - the height of the rectangle to be drawn in inches.

drawRoundRect

public void drawRoundRect(double x,
                          double y,
                          double width,
                          double height,
                          double arcWidth,
                          double arcHeight)
Draws an outlined round-cornered rectangle using this graphics context's current color. The left and right edges of the rectangle are at x and x + width, respectively. The top and bottom edges of the rectangle are at y and y + height.

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of the rectangle to be drawn in inches.
y - the y coordinate of the rectangle to be drawn in inches.
width - the width of the rectangle to be drawn in inches.
height - the height of the rectangle to be drawn in inches.
arcWidth - the horizontal diameter of the arc at the four corners in inches.
arcHeight - the vertical diameter of the arc at the four corners in inches.

fill3DRect

public void fill3DRect(double x,
                       double y,
                       double width,
                       double height,
                       boolean raised)
Paints a 3-D highlighted rectangle filled with the current color. The edges of the rectangle will be highlighted so that it appears as if the edges were beveled and lit from the upper left corner. The colors used for the highlighting effect will be determined from the current color.

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of the rectangle to be filled in inches.
y - the y coordinate of the rectangle to be filled in inches.
width - the width of the rectangle to be filled in inches.
height - the height of the rectangle to be filled in inches.
raised - a boolean value that determines whether the rectangle appears to be raised above the surface or etched into the surface.

fillArc

public void fillArc(double x,
                    double y,
                    double width,
                    double height,
                    int startAngle,
                    int arcAngle)
Fills a circular or elliptical arc covering the specified rectangle.

The resulting arc begins at startAngle and extends for arcAngle degrees. Angles are interpreted such that 0 degrees is at the 3 o'clock position. A positive value indicates a counter-clockwise rotation while a negative value indicates a clockwise rotation.

The center of the arc is the center of the rectangle whose origin is (x, y) and whose size is specified by the width and height arguments.

The resulting arc covers an area width + 1 inches wide by height + 1 inches tall.

The angles are specified relative to the non-square extents of the bounding rectangle such that 45 degrees always falls on the line from the center of the ellipse to the upper right corner of the bounding rectangle. As a result, if the bounding rectangle is noticeably longer in one axis than the other, the angles to the start and end of the arc segment will be skewed farther along the longer axis of the bounds.

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of the upper-left corner of the arc to be filled in inches.
y - the y coordinate of the upper-left corner of the arc to be filled in inches.
width - the width of the arc to be filled in inches.
height - the height of the arc to be filled in inches.
startAngle - the beginning angle.
arcAngle - the angular extent of the arc, relative to the start angle.

fillOval

public void fillOval(double x,
                     double y,
                     double width,
                     double height)
Fills an oval bounded by the specified rectangle with the current color.

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of the upper left corner of the oval to be filled in inches.
y - the y coordinate of the upper left corner of the oval to be filled in inches.
width - the width of the oval to be filled in inches.
height - the height of the oval to be filled in inches.

fillPolygon

public void fillPolygon(double[] xPoints,
                        double[] yPoints,
                        int nPoints)
Fills a closed polygon defined by arrays of x and y coordinates.

This method draws the polygon defined by nPoint line segments, where the first nPoint - 1 line segments are line segments from (xPoints[i - 1], yPoints[i - 1]) to (xPoints[i], yPoints[i]), for 1 ≤ i ≤ nPoints. The figure is automatically closed by drawing a line connecting the final point to the first point, if those points are different.

The area inside the polygon is defined using an even-odd fill rule, also known as the alternating rule.

Parameters:
xPoints - a an array of x coordinates in inches.
yPoints - a an array of y coordinates in inches.
nPoints - a the total number of points.

fillRect

public void fillRect(double x,
                     double y,
                     double width,
                     double height)
Fills the specified rectangle. The left and right edges of the rectangle are at x and x + width - 1. The top and bottom edges are at y and y + height - 1. The resulting rectangle covers an area width inches wide by height inches tall. The rectangle is filled using the graphics context's current color.

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of the rectangle to be filled in inches.
y - the y coordinate of the rectangle to be filled in inches.
width - the width of the rectangle to be filled in inches.
height - the height of the rectangle to be filled in inches.

fillRoundRect

public void fillRoundRect(double x,
                          double y,
                          double width,
                          double height,
                          double arcWidth,
                          double arcHeight)
Draws an outlined round-cornered rectangle using this graphics context's current color. The left and right edges of the rectangle are at x and x + width, respectively. The top and bottom edges of the rectangle are at y and y + height.

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of the rectangle to be drawn in inches.
y - the y coordinate of the rectangle to be drawn.
width - the width of the rectangle to be drawn in inches.
height - the height of the rectangle to be drawn in inches.
arcWidth - the horizontal diameter of the arc at the four corners in inches.
arcHeight - the vertical diameter of the arc at the four corners in inches.

setClip

public void setClip(double x,
                    double y,
                    double width,
                    double height)
Sets the current clip to the rectangle specified by the given coordinates. This method sets the user clip, which is independent of the clipping associated with device bounds and window visibility. Rendering operations have no effect outside of the clipping area.

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of the new clip rectangle in inches.
y - the y coordinate of the new clip rectangle in inches.
width - the width of the new clip rectangle in inches.
height - the height of the new clip rectangle in inches.

setColor

public void setColor(java.awt.Color aColor)
Sets this graphics context's current color to the specified color. All subsequent graphics operations using this graphics context use this specified color.

Parameters:
aColor - the new rendering color.

setFont

public void setFont(java.lang.String fname,
                    int style,
                    double size)
Sets this graphics context's font to the specified font. All subsequent text operations using this graphics context use this font.

Parameters:
fname - the font name.
style - the style constant for the Font. The style argument is an integer bitmask that may be PLAIN, or a bitwise union of BOLD and/or ITALIC (for example, ITALIC or BOLD|ITALIC). If the style argument does not conform to one of the expected integer bitmasks then the style is set to PLAIN.
size - the size of the Font in inches

setPaintMode

public void setPaintMode()
Sets the paint mode of this graphics context to overwrite the destination with this graphics context's current color. This sets the logical pixel operation function to the paint or overwrite mode. All subsequent rendering operations will overwrite the destination with the current color.

setXORMode

public void setXORMode(java.awt.Color aColor)
Sets the paint mode of this graphics context to alternate between this graphics context's current color and the new specified color. This specifies that logical pixel operations are performed in the XOR mode, which alternates pixels between the current color and a specified XOR color.

When drawing operations are performed, pixels which are the current color are changed to the specified color, and vice versa.

Pixels that are of colors other than those two colors are changed in an unpredictable but reversible manner; if the same figure is drawn twice, then all pixels are restored to their original values.

Parameters:
aColor - the XOR alternation color

setMedia

public void setMedia(java.lang.String media)
Set paper size.

Parameters:
media - the paper size like "A4", "B4".

setOri

public void setOri(java.lang.String ori)
Set page orientation

Parameters:
ori - the page orientation, either "landscape" or "portrait".

setPrinter

public void setPrinter(java.lang.String printer)
Specifies the destination printer for jobs

Parameters:
printer - the destination

setCopy

public void setCopy(int c)
Specifies the number of copies the application should render for jobs

Parameters:
c - the number of copies

setHeader

public void setHeader(java.lang.String display,
                      java.lang.String fontName,
                      int fontStyle,
                      double fontSize)
Set header for each page. The "#page" in display string will be replaced with current page number, and "#total" will be replaced with total numbers. The header will be printed in the middle up of the page. The default header is null.

Parameters:
display - the string to print
fontName - font name
fontStyle - the style constant for the Font. The style argument is an integer bitmask that may be PLAIN, or a bitwise union of BOLD and/or ITALIC (for example, ITALIC or BOLD|ITALIC). If the style argument does not conform to one of the expected integer bitmasks then the style is set to PLAIN.
fontSize - font size in inches.

setHeader

public void setHeader(java.lang.String display,
                      java.lang.String fontName,
                      int fontStyle,
                      double fontSize,
                      double x,
                      double y,
                      double w,
                      int align)
Set header for each page. The "#page" in display string will be replaced with current page number, and "#total" will be replaced with number of total pages. The header will be printed in the middle upper of the page.

Parameters:
display - the string to print
fontName - font name
fontStyle - the style constant for the Font. The style argument is an integer bitmask that may be PLAIN, or a bitwise union of BOLD and/or ITALIC (for example, ITALIC or BOLD|ITALIC). If the style argument does not conform to one of the expected integer bitmasks then the style is set to PLAIN.
fontSize - font size in inches.
x - the x coordinate to draw.
y - the y coordinate to draw.
w - the width(height) of the head to draw.
align - alignment of the head.
See Also:
LEFT, RIGHT, BOTH, CENTER, SPREAD, VERTICAL, VBOTH, VSPREAD, VCENTER

setFooter

public void setFooter(java.lang.String display,
                      java.lang.String fontName,
                      int fontStyle,
                      double fontSize)
Set footer for each page. The "#page" in display string will be replaced with current page number, and "#total" will be replaced with total numbers. The footer will be printed in the middle lower of the page. The default header is "#page / #total"

Parameters:
display - the string to print
fontName - font name
fontStyle - the style constant for the Font. The style argument is an integer bitmask that may be PLAIN, or a bitwise union of BOLD and/or ITALIC (for example, ITALIC or BOLD|ITALIC). If the style argument does not conform to one of the expected integer bitmasks then the style is set to PLAIN.
fontSize - font size in inches.

                      double x,

                      int align)

fontSize - font size in inches.

                          int style)

                      double gap)

pageCreated

protected void pageCreated(EasyPrint pb)
A EasyPrint created by constructor EasyPrint() will call this method when a new page is created. Override this method in a subclass for a customized new page behavior.
